questions.Instruccion: Match the questions with the answers

questions.question: Where did you go on vacation?
questions.answer: We went to New York City!

questions.question: What did you do in New York?
questions.answer: We saw a play on Broadway

questions.question: What did you eat there?
questions.answer: We ate the fried chicken and waffles

questions.question: What else did you do?
questions.answer: Well, after the play, we went to the museums

questions.question: Which ones did you visit?
questions.answer: The Met, MOMA, Guggenheim and many more

questions.Instruccion: Read the paragraphs and drag them in order

questions.answer: A scanner is a device that scans images, printed text, hand writing or even objects and converts them to a digital image. To make it work, you first have to connect the scanner to your PC, most scanners connect with a USB cable.

Place the material you want to scan just as if you were using a photocopier. Turn the scanner on if necessary. Some scanners don't have a power button they turn on automatically when you plug them into your computer.
Press the scan button on the scanner or run the software to acquire a digital image.
Preview your scan in your computer's screen and select the scan area with the scanner's software. Set up the resolution and adjust other settings if necessary.
Click the scan button to scan the image and once it is over, save the image to your disk.

questions.Instruccion: Match the phrases to make sentences

questions.question: I have washed the dishes!

questions.answer: But you haven't put it in your backpack yet.

questions.answer: But you haven't taken off his leash!

questions.question: I have made my bed!
questions.answer: But you haven't picked up your clothes!
